text: [Music]
hey everybody Thomas Joseph here now I
get a lot of questions regarding your
kitchen conundrums and probably one of
the most popular is how to chop an onion
that's because they're used in so many
dishes and today I'm going to show you
the fast and easy way to chop your onion
so I have a medium to small size onion
here I'm going to cut it in half
lengthwise
just like this and then trim off the
stem end now use a paring knife and peel
away the skin so now you want to take
the flat side of the onion and place it
down and that will keep the onion nice
and stable when you're ready to chop it
now I have the root end still intact
because that's going to hold the onion
together slice into the onion lengthwise
and the distance between cuts determines
the size so if you are looking for
something that's a little bit bigger
more of a dice you want to go wider in
your slices but if you're looking for
something more fine like a mint you want
to go closer together so I'm just going
around the onion I'm cutting almost all
the way through right up to the root end
and now I'm going to slice crosswise
creating a nice sized chop just like
that I'm creating a mince this time
again I'm going to slice the onion
lengthwise I'm going a little bit closer
together and if you are one to cry when
you're chopping an onion it's really
important in a way to kind of alleviate
that is to have a very sharp knife also
if you breathe through your mouth you
are less likely to cry as well so again
I'm slicing lengthwise through the onion
close together and then make crosswise
cuts close together again and there you
have a beautiful nice fine mince now the
technique is all the same whether you're
dicing your onion whether you're finely
chopping it or
you're mincing it now you know the
technique and it's fast easy and you
will be cutting onions just like the
pros there you go
[Music]
you
